statements: UPDATE passengers SET age = 30, ticket_purchased_date = '2022-09-15' WHERE passenger_id = 101;
UPDATE passengers SET gender = 'Female', travel_history = '{"country": "USA", "duration": "5 days"}' WHERE passenger_id = 102;
UPDATE passengers SET name = 'Alice', age = 30 WHERE passenger_id = 101;
UPDATE passengers SET gender = 'Male', travel_history = '{"countries": ["USA", "Canada", "Mexico"]}' WHERE passenger_id = 102;
UPDATE ticket_purchases SET purchase_amount = 1500.50 WHERE passenger_id = 12345;
UPDATE travel_history SET destination_location = 'Los Angeles' WHERE passenger_id = 54321;
UPDATE ticket_purchases SET purchase_amount = 150.00 WHERE passenger_id = 1234;
UPDATE travel_history SET destination_location = 'Paris', travel_date = '2022-08-15' WHERE passenger_id = 5678;
UPDATE tickets SET purchase_date = '2021-10-15' WHERE ticket_id = 101;
UPDATE passengers SET age = 30, name = 'Alice' WHERE passenger_id = 201;
UPDATE tickets SET purchase_date = '2022-01-15' WHERE ticket_id = 101;
UPDATE passengers SET name = 'Alice', gender = 'Female' WHERE passenger_id = 201;
UPDATE ticket_purchase SET fare_amount = 50 WHERE ticket_id = 12345
UPDATE travel_history SET destination = 'New York', origin = 'Chicago' WHERE travel_id = 54321
UPDATE ticket_purchase SET fare_amount = 150.75, purchase_date = '2022-01-20' WHERE ticket_id = 12345;
UPDATE passenger_details SET contact_number = '+1-202-555-0101', address = '123 Main St' WHERE passenger_id = 9876;
UPDATE passengers SET age = 30, email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE passenger_id = 1;
UPDATE tickets SET price = 150.00, purchase_date = '2022-03-15' WHERE ticket_id = 101;
UPDATE passengers SET name = 'John Doe', age = 30, email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE passenger_id = 1;
UPDATE travel_history SET destination = 'Paris', mode_of_transport = 'Flight' WHERE passenger_id = 3;
